vision.notes: Likely present in most members, enabling host location and navigation. Details of visual acuity and spectral sensitivity are unknown at the family level.

chemoreception.notes: Crucial for host location and recognition, likely involving both olfactory (detecting volatile chemicals from a distance) and gustatory (contact chemoreception) mechanisms. Pheromones likely play a role in communication.

mechanoreception.notes: Important for detecting host movement and assessing host suitability for oviposition, via sensilla on antennae and legs.
